Detailed Description

template<typename T, int _ALIGN = 128, int __aligned_T_size = ALIGN_UP(sizeof(T), _ALIGN)>
class ctk::AlignedAllocator< T, _ALIGN, __aligned_T_size >

Aligned memory allocator (an alternative to std::allocator). Usage: 
    std::vector<int, AlignedAllocator<int> > v(30);
    std::vector<Data, AlignedAllocator<Data, 16> > data(5);

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T, int _ALIGN = 128, int __aligned_T_size = ALIGN_UP(sizeof(T), _ALIGN)>
pointer ctk::AlignedAllocator< T, _ALIGN, __aligned_T_size >::allocate ( size_type  num,
const void *  hint = 0,
bool  align_each = false 
) [inline]

Allocates aligned memory region

Note:
3rd param expects a boolean value which indicates if the caller want each allocated element to be aligned or not (default = false).
